datan

Class MinQdr

  • java.lang.Object
    • datan.MinQdr

  • public final class MinQdr
extends java.lang.Object
    A class determining the minimum of a function in n-dimensional space by the method of of the quadratic form.
    Author:
    Siegmund Brandt.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

    • Constructor Detail

      • MinQdr

        public MinQdr(DatanVector x0,
      int[] list,
      DatanUserFunction muf)

      • MinQdr

        public MinQdr(DatanVector x0,
      DatanUserFunction muf)

      • MinQdr

        public MinQdr(DatanVector x0,
      int[] list,
      int nstep,
      double epsilon,
      DatanUserFunction muf)
        Parameters:
        x0 - initial point in n-space.
        list - array containing the elements of a list specifying which of the n variables are fixed (list element = 0) and which are adjustable (list element = 1).
        nstep - maximal step number. Default: if a value <= 0 is used, then 1000 is taken instead.
        epsilon - accuracy. Default if a value <= 0. is used, then 1,E-8 is taken instead.
        muf - user function which must be an extension of the abstract class DatanUserFunction.

    • Method Detail

      • getSteps

        public int getSteps()
        Returns:
        the number of iteration steps needed, -1 if iteration failed.

      • hasConverged

        public boolean hasConverged()
        Returns:
        true if iteration successful, false otherwise.

      • getMinPosition

        public DatanVector getMinPosition()
        Returns:
        the postion of the minimum.

      • getMinimum

        public double getMinimum()
        Returns:
        the function value at the minimum.
